title: Please don't rework Varus
body:
He's been my favorite Marksman since he became a champion.
Don't do it, Riot!

Change his lore, change his looks for all I care, but don't give him a gameplay update! Please... I hate it when you guys delete a champ for good no reason and replace it with another champ that isn't even any better. Granted, you don't do it all the time, but you do it often enough to make me very, very afraid of a Varus rework. Especially since he's been in my top 5 favorite champs as a fill main basically forever.

replies.body:
We don't have any plans for a Varus rework. 

At some point there are some small gameplay tweaks I'd like to make. They're at the level of shifting a bit of power around and adding one additional effect to his kit though, not any major changes to how Varus plays. Also unlikely to happen for a while (hopefully sometime next year?).
Since you were his OG designer, how do you personally feel about his new stuff

I really like it overall. I like that Valmar/Kai have a more fleshed out relationship with each other and connection to the wider world.  I also think the twist on the normal Darkin weapon versus human power struggle of three instead of two's a nice touch, in particular because it allows us to tell more interesting and distinct stories with Varus going forwards. 

I do somewhat miss the tragedy of Varus choosing duty over family, realizing he'd made the wrong choice, and giving in to anger/evil. That was a pretty completed story arc though, with an inevitable 'now the Darkin takes over and Varus is just gone' bit left (dude had nothing to live for). I think we gain quite a bit more narrative wise than we lose as a result, in particular the potential for future storytelling.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hUHqsRdg,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2017-12-01T18:22:59.269+0000)
>
> the potential for future storytelling.

This same excuse was used for rewriting Trundle's lore in 2013.

How many Trundle stories have been told since 2013?

It's a cop-out and Riot has demonstrated they aren't going to follow through on it and are just deleting characters due to their own whims.

Before we try to take Riot to task for not putting out even more lore or trying to wrap up any of these hanging arcs they're leaving in their wake, (because believe me, I'm also frustrated with the pace and lack of focus) I think it's important to zoom out and look at the big picture; Runeterra is becoming more than the setting of LoL, it's becoming an IP.

If they want to do anything meaningful like set another genre of game in this universe, they're going to have to "seed" it with even more unresolved stuff than there already is. I want a lot more lore development too, but is a MOBA or the Universe website REALLY the best place to wrap up the whole Freljordian civil war, or would you rather play it out Banner Saga style as a strategy game?

Use other characters that happen to have unresolved storylines. Use new characters that were created with unresolved storylines. Maybe make some new characters specifically for the purposes of these secondary products.

And if you are going to change an old character, change as little as possible to serve the needs. In the Rolling Stone interview you have Rioters talking about an element of Varus's lore as not absolutely necessary for Varus so they threw it out. It should be the other way around, "Is it absolutely necessary that we have to change this element for the sake of the game? No? Then we should leave it as-is."

If Riot has new ideas for a new story, then it should be associated with a new character.
beat me to it.

In all honesty, old Trundle was a character closed into himself. His story was done, his race was shrugged off in order to have a proper IP ( i would not be surprised to see trolls as some odd form of Vastayans) and had zero connection to the rest of the world as a character, nor his tribe did.

They are at fault for not doing much stuff on him, but at least he  and his race has a part on the world. Trolls now appear in some stories too, like Braum and Ryze, and they could not or would have been dispersive if Trundle was still the leaper troll.

They could have written the old Trundle story into the world while maintaining most of what made the old Trundle who he was.

And honestly, even if he was left in that state where he was not really part of the rest of the story, that would be better than what actually happened to him.

Sorry, but that's wrong. In 5 minutes I can come up with a solution. Pretty sure the team could too.  
Something like "Varus finally accepted the Darkin's deal: a revenge in exchange for the Darkin's delivrance. But with time, the Darkin came to understand how human feelings worked, he understood what drove Varus mad." The story officially ends here, but there is a possibility of them making peace, since their goals aren't this separate one from another. Maybe the Darkin is okay with killing only Noxians for eternity. Maybe they both realize that killing isn't the solution? Maybe in the end, the Darkin still fully consumes Varus because even though he "liked" him (as much as a Darkin can like), he wasn't attached enough to not take his part of the deal.  
  
This litterally took me less than 5 minutes, and a story built upon that (with the talent of a true narrative team, I'm just a randumb that doesn't even speak english correctly) would have pleased everyone. Why? Because it didn't change core things, it just added things.  
Why didn't the narrative team do that kind of work instead of an (almost) full retcon?

I'd argue that a story is better if it ends instead of gets dragged out into a 2 season filler arc while we wait for the manga to catch up for what'll end up being a disappointing ending anyways.

Some stories don't need a new take, or a reboot, or whatever.

you could probably swap his innate Blighted quiver passive with his E passive and then make E a activatable steroid that does something cool like

- splitting his shots  ala Runaans
- giving his basic attacks a "piercing" effect that allows you to damage lined up targets same as Xayah/Twitch.

Alternatively if you dont want to "overload" players by adding an extra active skill to his kit you could simply give him a more synergistic passive like what you did with Singed.
